intro: Epilobium × bollianum, commonly known as the Bolliana willowherb, is a hybrid plant species belonging to the Onagraceae family. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit and is native to Europe and parts of Asia. The plant typically features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture and produces clusters of pink to reddish-purple flowers. Epilobium × bollianum thrives in moist, disturbed habitats such as riverbanks and wet meadows. It is often found in areas with rich, loamy soil and can tolerate partial shade to full sun.
